content: click settings>composition and UNtick the box for paragraph formatting vs body text. That should revert to single spacing.

Use https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/120.0b6/mac/ and start it from a terminal with the following on the command line 

 --allow-downgrade
creator: wsmwk

content:
Hi Žan, Is this a new account and you can't connect or it's your existing account that stopped working?

0.Check your internet connection: Make sure you have a stable internet connection and that your network is not blocking SMTP traffic. 1.Check gmail server status (https://www.google.com/appsstatus/dashboard/): 2.Check SMTP server settings: Ensure that you have entered the correct SMTP server settings for Gmail. The SMTP server for Gmail is smtp.gmail.com and the port number is 465 or 587. Also, make sure you have enabled the “Allow less secure apps” option in your Gmail account settings. 3.Disable antivirus or firewall temporarily: Disable any antivirus or firewall programs temporarily as they may be blocking the SMTP traffic. 4. Check your VPN client wether it disables the SMTP ports

content: OK. In normal startup, try disabling Hardware Acceleration in settings. Does that help?
creator: wsmwk

content:
I didn't see that someone already have the same problem, the fix is (from thread"Mouse scroll wheel not working anywhere in V115"): "Start TB in normal mode, disable hardware acceleration in Settings/General/Indexing, restart TB, test the scrolling."

Thanks for help, now I can back from bad Outlook and I'm very happy ;)
creator: longinbrzeczyszczykiewicz

content: Depending on how completely you uninstalled, it may still be in an unused profile. I'm not familiar with version 60, but if the setup is the same, look in c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles This will have one or more profile folders. Look in each for a file named abook.sqlite. If in more than one profile, the larger one or recently updated one would be it. If you find it, it doesn't work with version 60.
creator: davidsk
